comments: We currently run multiple jobs, should be more like the CVS synchronization.
Oops, didn't mean to assign it to you ;)

Now that we're properly maintaining synchronization state I'm seeing major performance issues on startup where the synchronization jobs take so much CPU as to make my Eclipse unusable.  I fixed up the priorities some which helped, but we might be having problems with IO synchronization access to the offline file.  We need to swith to a single job that updates its description accordingly.
For the time being I changed the "MAX_REFRESH_JOBS" to 1 and that has addressed the CPU usage problem.

Created an attachment (id=42085)
mylar/context/zip

context for repository synchronization update

Getting URI errors: http://www.checkupdown.com/status/E414.html

java.io.IOException: HTTP Error 414 (Request-URI Too Large) while querying Bugzilla Server.  Check Bugzilla preferences.
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.ui.search.RepositoryQueryFactory.performQuery(RepositoryQueryFactory.java:77)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.ui.tasklist.BugzillaRepositoryConnector.getChangedSinceLastSync(BugzillaRepositoryConnector.java:768)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.provisional.tasklist.SynchronizeQueryJob.run(SynchronizeQueryJob.java:84)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Fix for above exception in HEAD.
The new synchronization seems to be working well. For issues related to duplicate and cancellable synchronizations see bug 143011. Marking this report resolved.

This is almost there now, but I'm failing to see incoming comments for bugs that have fallen out of queries.  How about we change it to, 
  for reach repository kind:
    1) synch every query 
    2) synch every repository report in the entire list, including archive)

Also, for 2 we should set the progress to be the total number of reports, and increment accordingly.
If we do a 'query like' synch on the Archive (checking for reports that have changed) wouldn't that cover all reports (since they should all be in the archive)?

Yes, that should do it.  But it should probably still be batched by repository.

Btw, it seems that my periodic synchonization is no longer running periodically.  Is yours?
Okay.  Yup, synch working fine here since your comment just appeared as incoming on this report. :) With this working now, I'm really needing the incoming notifications.
Guys, wouldn't it make more sense to use special logical model and Team Synchronize view to coordinate incoming and ougoing changes?
It could.  We will need to consider that for 0.7 when we stop merging back to 3.1 and make the 3.1 support a seperate service branch.
